intro: Metastelma blodgettii, commonly known as the Blodgett's metastelma, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
